Bosai:Disaster Response Robots
BOSAI:Disaster Response Robots/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮを放送しています。詳しくはホームページをご覧ください。 nhk.jp/nhkworld
programme.title: BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.

The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings. In the aftermath of a major disaster like that as well as an earthquake or fire, robots can quickly enter dangerous sites that are inaccessible to humans, find people in need of rescue, and take detailed measurements to provide data about the site. In this episode, we'll look at the latest developments among Japan's "disaster response robots."

programme.title: Witnesses to the Cambodian Genocide
programme.desc: Fifty years after the Cambodian Genocide, survivors -both victims and those involved in the killings- reflect on how and why Cambodians turned against one another, and on the deep scars left behind.

programme.title: Let's Enjoy MATH with Barky the Dog
programme.desc: Children wish to share a cake, but are confused when Numbler cuts the cake into different shapes. Barky uses the basics of fractions and geometry to prove that the pieces are indeed equal.

Children wish to share a cake, but are confused when Numbler cuts the cake into different shapes. Are the pieces equal in size? Barky uses the basics of fractions and geometry to prove that the pieces are indeed equal.

programme.title: TAKE TECH
programme.desc: A program for upper primary to lower secondary school children to explore the everyday technologies all around them. Each episode takes a piece of familiar tech to find out what it does and how.
How does a flush toilet work? This episode goes inside the tank of a toilet to trace the flow of water.

programme.title: SAMURAI WISDOM
programme.desc: Painted as a foolish ruler in works of fiction, fifth Tokugawa Shogun, Tsunayoshi. But is this depiction justified? Even he has wisdom to share.
Tsunayoshi, the fifth Tokugawa Shogun, is painted as a foolish ruler in works of fiction... but is this depiction justified? Even he has wisdom to share!
programme.title: Time and Tide
Magical Japanese
Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to shadow or shade. Explore the unique culture behind them.

The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to kage, meaning both shadow and shade. From rooting for someone working toward their dreams, to expressing appreciation for those around you, words involving kage are surprisingly common in daily conversation. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through such unique words and the culture behind them.

programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat Of Japan
MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo, Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.
In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo in Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.

Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon is a 300-year-old matsuri held in Yatsuo, Toyama Prefecture. Eleven neighborhoods choose their own routes, dances and parade styles, all of which feature elegant music, dancing and singing. Originally a prayer for bountiful harvests and lasting prosperity, it is a community event in which only local people dance and perform. With the threat of COVID-19 receding, the festival went ahead in 2022 for the first time in three years, to the great delight of Yatsuo residents.

Language instructors teach expressions and phrases as well as Japanese business etiquette rules to foreigners who currently work in Japan.

Today: pointing out a senior coworker's mistake. Kyaw Swar Aung, from Myanmar, works behind the scenes at Narita Airport. He carries out tasks such as guiding aircraft as well as loading and unloading baggage. He's learned that both caution and precision are necessary to prevent accidents. He knows to report anything out of the ordinary, as well as any errors. He'll tackle a roleplay challenge in which he notices a senior worker's mistake. How will he handle the situation?

programme.title: Zero Waste Life
programme.desc: Okinawa is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make things to be loved and never again thrown away, doing his part to reduce waste.
programme.title: Zero Waste Life
Zero Waste Life/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: モノを大切にする「MOTTAINAI」精神を育んできた日本。「捨てない暮らし」を実践する人々を各地で取材し、世界に発信する。
Okinawa is home to 'Ryukyu Glass', a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make things to be loved and never again thrown away, doing his part to reduce waste.
Okinawa is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make...
Meet people around Japan who strive for a life without waste under the traditional philosophy of "MOTTAINAI," which values cherishing the things we have.

Two years ago, dyer Izawa Tsuyoshi began dyeing old clothes black. Black hides damage and stains and makes old look new. His back-in-black service is now so popular there's a three-month waiting list.

The Japanese southern island of Okinawa Prefecture, warm all year, this popular tourist spot is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Glass blower Matsumoto Sakae insists on using discarded bottles as raw material. He says their status as trash inspires him to give them beauty, making things that will be loved and never again thrown away. Hoping, in some small way, to reduce waste in the world, he keeps his furnace hot and his tools ready.

Puppet action show for young children, produced for utilization in moral education classes in schools in Japan. In a distant post-human future where surviving creatures have formed a community, new-breed dinosaur girl Rockie sets out on hilarious adventures with her schoolmates.

Language instructors teach expressions and phrases as well as Japanese business etiquette rules to foreigners who currently work in Japan.

Today: pointing out a senior coworker's mistake. Kyaw Swar Aung, from Myanmar, works behind the scenes at Narita Airport. He carries out tasks such as guiding aircraft as well as loading and unloading baggage. He's learned that both caution and precision are necessary to prevent accidents. He knows to report anything out of the ordinary, as well as any errors. He'll tackle a roleplay challenge in which he notices a senior worker's mistake. How will he handle the situation?

programme.title: Zero Waste Life
programme.desc: Okinawa is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make things to be loved and never again thrown away, doing his part to reduce waste.
programme.title: Zero Waste Life
Zero Waste Life/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: モノを大切にする「MOTTAINAI」精神を育んできた日本。「捨てない暮らし」を実践する人々を各地で取材し、世界に発信する。
Okinawa is home to 'Ryukyu Glass', a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make things to be loved and never again thrown away, doing his part to reduce waste.
Okinawa is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make...
Meet people around Japan who strive for a life without waste under the traditional philosophy of "MOTTAINAI," which values cherishing the things we have.

Two years ago, dyer Izawa Tsuyoshi began dyeing old clothes black. Black hides damage and stains and makes old look new. His back-in-black service is now so popular there's a three-month waiting list.

The Japanese southern island of Okinawa Prefecture, warm all year, this popular tourist spot is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Glass blower Matsumoto Sakae insists on using discarded bottles as raw material. He says their status as trash inspires him to give them beauty, making things that will be loved and never again thrown away. Hoping, in some small way, to reduce waste in the world, he keeps his furnace hot and his tools ready.
Okinawa is home to Ryukyu Glass, a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make things to be loved and never again thrown away, doing his part to reduce waste.

Accelerate your Japanese language skills! Learn practical, effective workplace expressions, understand business culture and improve your kanji.

Today: pointing out a senior coworker's mistake. Kyaw Swar Aung, from Myanmar, works behind the scenes at Narita Airport. He carries out tasks such as guiding aircraft as well as loading and unloading baggage. He's learned that both caution and precision are necessary to prevent accidents. He knows to report anything out of the ordinary, as well as any errors. He'll tackle a roleplay challenge in which he notices a senior worker's mistake. How will he handle the situation?

programme.title: Zero Waste Life
programme.desc: Okinawa is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make things to be loved and never again thrown away, doing his part to reduce waste.

Meet people around Japan who strive for a life without waste under the traditional philosophy of "MOTTAINAI," which values cherishing the things we have.
programme.title: Zero Waste Life/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: モノを大切にする「MOTTAINAI」精神を育んできた日本。「捨てない暮らし」を実践する人々を各地で取材し、世界に発信する。

The Japanese southern island of Okinawa Prefecture, warm all year, this popular tourist spot is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Glass blower Matsumoto Sakae insists on using discarded bottles as raw material. He says their status as trash inspires him to give them beauty, making things that will be loved and never again thrown away. Hoping, in some small way, to reduce waste in the world, he keeps his furnace hot and his tools ready.

programme.title: Zero Waste Life
programme.desc: Okinawa is home to Ryukyu Glass, a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make things to be loved and never again thrown away, doing his part to reduce waste.

Pointing out a senior coworkers mistake. Kyaw Swar Aung, from Myanmar, works behind the scenes at Narita Airport. Hell tackle a roleplay challenge in which he notices a senior workers mistake.

Today: pointing out a senior coworker's mistake. Kyaw Swar Aung, from Myanmar, works behind the scenes at Narita Airport. He carries out tasks such as guiding aircraft as well as loading and unloading baggage. He's learned that both caution and precision are necessary to prevent accidents. He knows to report anything out of the ordinary, as well as any errors. He'll tackle a roleplay challenge in which he notices a senior worker's mistake. How will he handle the situation?

programme.title: Zero Waste Life
programme.desc: Okinawa is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make things to be loved and never again thrown away, doing his part to reduce waste.

Meet people around Japan who strive for a life without waste under the traditional philosophy of "MOTTAINAI," which values cherishing the things we have.
programme.title: Zero Waste Life/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: モノを大切にする「MOTTAINAI」精神を育んできた日本。「捨てない暮らし」を実践する人々を各地で取材し、世界に発信する。

The Japanese southern island of Okinawa Prefecture, warm all year, this popular tourist spot is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Glass blower Matsumoto Sakae insists on using discarded bottles as raw material. He says their status as trash inspires him to give them beauty, making things that will be loved and never again thrown away. Hoping, in some small way, to reduce waste in the world, he keeps his furnace hot and his tools ready.

programme.title: Time-Lapse Japan
programme.desc: The Jomon period dates roughly from 13,000 to 300 BC. We examine various aspects of Jomon society, with footage from time-lapse creator Shimizu Daisuke. This time: the Oyu Stone Circles.
programme.title: CINEMATIC JOURNEY
programme.desc: Kyle Card hikes along the 1000km trail following the Pacific Coast in northern Japanwhere he discovers local lifestyles, stunning nature, traces of the area's 2011 disaster, and resilient people.

programme.title: BOSAI: Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings.
programme.title: BOSAI: Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: Disaster Response Robots: If disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people if fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents prevent smooth recovery - that's where robots can help.

The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings. In the aftermath of a major disaster like that as well as an earthquake or fire, robots can quickly enter dangerous sites that are inaccessible to humans, find people in need of rescue, and take detailed measurements to provide data about the site. In this episode, we'll look at the latest developments among Japan's "disaster response robots."

The Manyoshu is the oldest extant anthology of Japanese poetry. Through poems presented in both manga and modern settings, we glimpse sentiments from centuries ago. The topic this time is love. The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to mud. Explore the unique culture behind them.
Explore the richness and depth of the Japanese language and discover how words and expressions reflect history, culture and the natural world.
programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to doro, or mud. Since ancient times, Japanese people have gotten muddy in the rice paddies, cultivating their main staple. Perhaps because of this, there are a surprising number of expressions related to mud in Japanese. And reflecting such a place of hard work, many of them are used in business situations. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through unique words born from "mud."

Traveling across Japan, we can find many bridges of all shapes and sizes. In Tokyo, building modern bridges was one way to join the club of advanced industrial nations in the late 19th century, when Japan was vying to catch up with Western technology. A small bridge in Iwate Prefecture is hand-made. Even if relatively few people use it, it is an important crossing for the local community. Today, we hear the story of bridges linking communities throughout Japan.

Traditional festivals called matsuri are found all over Japan. In this series, we present diverse matsuri and the preparations leading up to them. Each matsuri presents a new face of local Japan. programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture - adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.

Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Here, the shishi symbolizes the harshness and bounty of the natural world, and the matsuri focuses on the importance of harmony between people and nature. Adults play the role of the enormous shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects. This event is also an opportunity for local families to wish for happy marriages and children, and the shishi dances in celebration.

The Manyoshu is the oldest extant anthology of Japanese poetry. Through poems presented in both manga and modern settings, we glimpse sentiments from centuries ago. The topic this time is love. The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to mud. Explore the unique culture behind them.
Explore the richness and depth of the Japanese language and discover how words and expressions reflect history, culture and the natural world.
programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode looks at words related to spring. Explore the unique culture behind them.

The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to doro, or mud. Since ancient times, Japanese people have gotten muddy in the rice paddies, cultivating their main staple. Perhaps because of this, there are a surprising number of expressions related to mud in Japanese. And reflecting such a place of hard work, many of them are used in business situations. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through unique words born from "mud."

Traveling across Japan, we can find many bridges of all shapes and sizes. In Tokyo, building modern bridges was one way to join the club of advanced industrial nations in the late 19th century, when Japan was vying to catch up with Western technology. A small bridge in Iwate Prefecture is hand-made. Even if relatively few people use it, it is an important crossing for the local community. Today, we hear the story of bridges linking communities throughout Japan.

programme.title: Kid's discovery
programme.desc: Traditional festivals called matsuri are found all over Japan. In this series, we present diverse matsuri and the preparations leading up to them. Traditional festivals called matsuri are found all over Japan. In this series, we present diverse matsuri and the preparations leading up to them. Each matsuri presents a new face of local Japan.
programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture - adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.

Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Here, the shishi symbolizes the harshness and bounty of the natural world, and the matsuri focuses on the importance of harmony between people and nature. Adults play the role of the enormous shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects. This event is also an opportunity for local families to wish for happy marriages and children, and the shishi dances in celebration.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Bustling Scenes of Old Tokyo(3)
Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE(3)
programme.desc: Centuries ago, Tokyo was known as Edo. More than a million people enjoyed life in this small but abundant city. They live on in ukiyo-e woodblock prints. Each episode is a deep dive into a single print, and an exploration of the soul of Old Tokyo. We examine works by artists like Hokusai and Hiroshige not just for their aesthetic and historical value, but for the stories they tell of everyday life. That is how the people of Edo themselves enjoyed this mass-produced medium.
programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-Life
programme.desc: In the pleasure quarters of Edo, a precious house cat stares longingly out the window at a crowd of people going to and fro. Telltale signs scattered about the room reveal why it appears to be upset.

Traditional festivals called matsuri are found all over Japan. In this series, we present diverse matsuri and the preparations leading up to them. Each matsuri presents a new face of local Japan. Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.
Traditional festivals called matsuri are found all over Japan. In this series, we present diverse matsuri and the preparations leading up to them. Each matsuri presents a new face of local Japan.
programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture - adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.

Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Here, the shishi symbolizes the harshness and bounty of the natural world, and the matsuri focuses on the importance of harmony between people and nature. Adults play the role of the enormous shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects. This event is also an opportunity for local families to wish for happy marriages and children, and the shishi dances in celebration.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode looks at words related to spring. Explore the unique culture behind them.

The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to doro, or mud. Since ancient times, Japanese people have gotten muddy in the rice paddies, cultivating their main staple. Perhaps because of this, there are a surprising number of expressions related to mud in Japanese. And reflecting such a place of hard work, many of them are used in business situations. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through unique words born from "mud."

Traveling across Japan, we can find many bridges of all shapes and sizes. In Tokyo, building modern bridges was one way to join the club of advanced industrial nations in the late 19th century, when Japan was vying to catch up with Western technology. A small bridge in Iwate Prefecture is hand-made. Even if relatively few people use it, it is an important crossing for the local community. Today, we hear the story of bridges linking communities throughout Japan.

programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture - adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.

Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Here, the shishi symbolizes the harshness and bounty of the natural world, and the matsuri focuses on the importance of harmony between people and nature. Adults play the role of the enormous shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects. This event is also an opportunity for local families to wish for happy marriages and children, and the shishi dances in celebration.

programme.title: Chatroom Japan
programme.desc: German urbanist Chris Dimmer focuses on the community-building potential of Japan's public bathhouses, or `sento'. He hopes that people living alone can rediscover the value of these bathhouses.

programme.desc: Bari is a port town located at the heel of the Italian peninsula; an important hub of commerce since the time of ancient Rome, it's known for welcoming people of diverse cultures from Asia and Africa.

Chatroom Japan empowers international residents in Japan to share their experiences and connect with each other. German urbanist Chris Dimmer focuses on the community-building potential of Japan's public bathhouses, or "Sento." He hopes that people living alone can rediscover the value of these bathhouses.
programme.sub-title: The Local "Sento" - More Than a Bath
programme.desc: Have you ever been to a sento? Christian Dimmer, a German urbanist living in Japan, focuses on the community-building potential of Japan's public bathhouses. It is common these days in our society to live alone or in single-family units. He hopes that people can rediscover the value of the community communication nourished by public bathhouses.

programme.desc: Explores the story behind one of Tsutaju's most well-known masterpieces, `The Actor Otani Oniji III as Edobei', which is the ukiyo-e producer's debut work.

programme.title: Magical Japanese/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: 長い歴史と共に先人から受け継がれてきた日本語は、四季の彩りにあふれ、人の気持ちに寄り添うこともできる表現が豊富。多彩な語彙や語源など日本語の魅力を届けます。

The Manyoshu is the oldest extant anthology of Japanese poetry. Through poems presented in both manga and modern settings, we glimpse sentiments from centuries ago. The topic this time is love. The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to mud. Explore the unique culture behind them.
programme.title: Biz Stream
programme.desc: Shoring Up Short-Handed Kitchens: This episode features new services and cooking equipment designed to help restaurants in Japan overcome a deepening labour shortage.
Explore the richness and depth of the Japanese language and discover how words and expressions reflect history, culture and the natural world.
programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode looks at words related to spring. Explore the unique culture behind them.

The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to doro, or mud. Since ancient times, Japanese people have gotten muddy in the rice paddies, cultivating their main staple. Perhaps because of this, there are a surprising number of expressions related to mud in Japanese. And reflecting such a place of hard work, many of them are used in business situations. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through unique words born from "mud."

Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Bustling Scenes of Old Tokyo(3)
Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE(3)
programme.desc: Centuries ago, Tokyo was known as Edo. More than a million people enjoyed life in this small but abundant city. They live on in ukiyo-e woodblock prints. Each episode is a deep dive into a single print, and an exploration of the soul of Old Tokyo. We examine works by artists like Hokusai and Hiroshige not just for their aesthetic and historical value, but for the stories they tell of everyday life. That is how the people of Edo themselves enjoyed this mass-produced medium.
programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-Life

programme.title: Seasoning The Seasons
programme.desc: This programme visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

Traveling across Japan, we can find many bridges of all shapes and sizes. In Tokyo, building modern bridges was one way to join the club of advanced industrial nations in the late 19th century, when Japan was vying to catch up with Western technology. A small bridge in Iwate Prefecture is hand-made. Even if relatively few people use it, it is an important crossing for the local community. Today, we hear the story of bridges linking communities throughout Japan.

Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Here, the shishi symbolizes the harshness and bounty of the natural world, and the matsuri focuses on the importance of harmony between people and nature. Adults play the role of the enormous shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects. This event is also an opportunity for local families to wish for happy marriages and children, and the shishi dances in celebration.

The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to doro, or mud. Since ancient times, Japanese people have gotten muddy in the rice paddies, cultivating their main staple. Perhaps because of this, there are a surprising number of expressions related to mud in Japanese. And reflecting such a place of hard work, many of them are used in business situations. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through unique words born from "mud."

programme.desc: Sheila Cliffe ventures from the northern Kanto to Yokohama where the silks were exported to the world during the late 1850s.
Sheila Cliffe follows Japan's silk road from Tomioka to the port of Yokohama where she encounters architecture designed for silkworms, modernized reeling machinery, weavers and historians.
programme.title: Dining with the Chef
programme.desc: English-speaking visitors travel the length of Japan, exploring the local culture, meeting the people and offering travel hints rarely found in guidebooks. Get to know useful travel tips! Sheila Cliffe follows Japan's silk road from Tomioka to the port of Yokohama where she encounters architecture designed for silkworms, modernized reeling machinery, weavers and historians.

Documentary series that follows foreign visitors as they travel the length of Japan, explore the local culture, and meet some new and colourful people along the way. On their adventures, they will offer viewers a variety of valuable travel hints that can rarely be found in guidebooks.
programme.sub-title: SILK Road: Threads of History from Gunma to Yokohama
programme.desc: In 1859, when Japan reopened its doors after more than two centuries of isolation, goods flowed in and out of newly expanded ports. At the time, raw silk became the country's largest export, as the silk industries in France and Italy had been hit by an epidemic of silkworm disease. At one point, Japan was the world's biggest exporter. On this episode of Journeys in Japan, Sheila Cliffe from the UK follows the Silk Road from northern Kanto, once a major production area, to Yokohama, where the silk took off to the world.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.
programme.title: MATSURI
programme.desc: Traditional festivals called matsuri are found all over Japan. In this series, we present diverse matsuri and the preparations leading up to them. Each matsuri presents a new face of local Japan. Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.

Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Here, the shishi symbolizes the harshness and bounty of the natural world, and the matsuri focuses on the importance of harmony between people and nature. Adults play the role of the enormous shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects. This event is also an opportunity for local families to wish for happy marriages and children, and the shishi dances in celebration.

programme.title: Nun's Cookbook
programme.desc: The nuns of Otowasan Kannonji Temple are cooking up a storm and inviting the viewer into their monastery to show them the correct way to prepare su-no-mono with dried daikon radish.
The temple chefs show us how to make su-no-mono with dried daikon radish. Just mix rehydrated daikon with red radish and sweet vinegar, and this tasty pink-colored dish is ready to serve.

programme.sub-title: SILK Road: Threads of History from Gunma to Yokohama
programme.desc: In 1859, when Japan reopened its doors after more than two centuries of isolation, goods flowed in and out of newly expanded ports. At the time, raw silk became the country's largest export, as the silk industries in France and Italy had been hit by an epidemic of silkworm disease. At one point, Japan was the world's biggest exporter. On this episode of Journeys in Japan, Sheila Cliffe from the UK follows the Silk Road from northern Kanto, once a major production area, to Yokohama, where the silk took off to the world.

programme.title: BOSAI: Science That Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.

Japan has a long history of natural disasters. BOSAI explores how to overcome them and save lives with the power of science. When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.

The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings. In the aftermath of a major disaster like that as well as an earthquake or fire, robots can quickly enter dangerous sites that are inaccessible to humans, find people in need of rescue, and take detailed measurements to provide data about the site. In this episode, we'll look at the latest developments among Japan's "disaster response robots."

programme.title: Historical Drama "UNBOUND"
Historical Drama "UNBOUND" (R)
programme.desc: The story depicts the turbulent life of Tsutaya Juzaburo (Yokohama Ryusei), known as "Tsutaju", a man who laid the foundation for Japan's media industry and pop culture. Despite the close scrutiny of the shogunate, he relentlessly pursued humor and entertainment. This thrilling drama is filled with laughter, tears, and mystery.
programme.title: Unbound, Ep 42
programme.desc: Harumachi takes his own life, and Kisanji departs. As Tsutaju's trusted writers leave one after another, he turns to Masanobu with a request to write
programme.title: Unbound, Ep 42
programme.desc: Harumachi bunuh diri, dan Kisanji pergi. Seiring dengan kepergian para penulis tepercaya Tsutaju satu per satu, ia meminta Masanobu untuk menulis.
programme.title: UNBOUND
programme.desc: Tsutaju manages to recover his business with Utamaro's upper-body portrait series 'Fujin Sogaku Juttai.' As the new year begins, he rebuilds his shop after losing half his fortune. Furthermore, Utamaro's latest nishikie, portraying Edo's poster girls, becomes a huge hit, breathing new life into the town and drawing crowds to the shops. Amidst this renewed bustle, Tei tells Tsutaju she's pregnant. Meanwhile, Sadanobu begins to lose support within the shogunate due to his hardline stance on foreign and imperial matters.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE (R)
programme.desc: Let's look into the world of Ukiyoe to learn how people lived in Edo period!

Centuries ago, Tokyo was known as Edo. More than a million people enjoyed life in this small but abundant city. They live on in ukiyo-e woodblock prints. Each episode is a deep dive into a single print, and an exploration of the soul of Old Tokyo. We examine works by artists like Hokusai and Hiroshige not just for their aesthetic and historical value, but for the stories they tell of everyday life. That is how the people of Edo themselves enjoyed this mass-produced medium.
programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-Life

Night Drama Serial
programme.desc: Night Drama Serial
programme.title: Hirayasumi, Ep 1
programme.desc: Ikuta Hiroto, 29. He has no full-time job, no partner, no plan for the future and he couldn't be happier. He's just fine, unfettered and carefree. One day, Hiroto ends up inheriting a "hiraya" (one-story house) from an elderly neighbor whom he befriended purely by his personable nature.
programme.title: Hirayasumi, Ep 1
programme.desc: Ikuta Hiroto, 29. Ia tidak memiliki pekerjaan penuh-waktu, tidak sama, tidak ada rencana untuk masa depan—dan dia tidak bisa lebih bahagia. Dia baik-baik saja, tak terkekang, dan riang. Suatu hari, Hiroto akhirnya mewarisi "hiraya" (rumah satu lantai) dari seorang tetangga tua yang dia jadikan teman murni karena kepribadiannya.
programme.title: Hirayasumi
programme.desc: A warm and bittersweet drama based on the internationally beloved manga by Shinzo Keigo. Ikuta Hiroto (Okayama Amane), 29, has no job, no romantic partner, and none of the usual worries about the future. Drawn to his easygoing personality, a local elderly woman gives him a single-story house. He begins living with his 18-year-old cousin Natsumi (Mori Nana), who has just moved to Tokyo from Yamagata. Before long, people carrying quiet burdens begin to gather around him.

programme.title: End-Of-Life Planning..., Ep 1

programme.title: End-of-life Planning Shared House
programme.desc: In a shared house on the outskirts of Tokyo, three lifelong friends live together, led by culinary expert Utako (Takeshita Keiko). One day, university student Hayami Shota (Jo Kairi) is invited to be Utako's secretary, sparking a lively exchange between generations. Later, their old friend Tsuneko (Ichige Yoshie), who shows signs of Mild Cognitive Impairment, joins them, throwing things into a bit of chaos. They also begin to confront the real-life challenges of senior living. The drama, with warmth and quiet resolve, asks a timeless question: What does it mean to live?

programme.title: Ultra Heavy Machinery 5min.
programme.desc: Ultra Heavy Machinery 5min.
programme.title: Ultra Heavy Machinery
programme.desc: The world loves Japan's heavy machinery. We explore the secrets of its popularity and learn about items ranging from small excavators to cranes that erect skyscrapers in cramped urban spaces.
programme.title: Ultra Heavy Machinery
programme.desc: The program brings you the unknown world of heavy machineries around the world. In this episode, heavy machinery specialized for specific tasks appear in various parts of Japan.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: Let's look into the world of Ukiyoe to learn how people lived in Edo period!

Centuries ago, Tokyo was known as Edo. More than a million people enjoyed life in this small but abundant city. They live on in ukiyo-e woodblock prints. Each episode is a deep dive into a single print, and an exploration of the soul of Old Tokyo. We examine works by artists like Hokusai and Hiroshige not just for their aesthetic and historical value, but for the stories they tell of everyday life. That is how the people of Edo themselves enjoyed this mass-produced medium.
programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-Life

Historical Drama "UNBOUND"
Historical Drama "UNBOUND" Eps. 42
programme.desc: The story depicts the turbulent life of Tsutaya Juzaburo (Yokohama Ryusei), known as "Tsutaju", a man who laid the foundation for Japan's media industry and pop culture. Despite the close scrutiny of the shogunate, he relentlessly pursued humor and entertainment. This thrilling drama is filled with laughter, tears, and mystery.
programme.title: Unbound, Ep 42
programme.desc: Harumachi takes his own life, and Kisanji departs. As Tsutaju's trusted writers leave one after another, he turns to Masanobu with a request to write
programme.title: Unbound, Ep 42
programme.desc: Harumachi bunuh diri, dan Kisanji pergi. Seiring dengan kepergian para penulis tepercaya Tsutaju satu per satu, ia meminta Masanobu untuk menulis.
programme.title: UNBOUND
programme.desc: Tsutaju manages to recover his business with Utamaro's upper-body portrait series 'Fujin Sogaku Juttai.' As the new year begins, he rebuilds his shop after losing half his fortune. Furthermore, Utamaro's latest nishikie, portraying Edo's poster girls, becomes a huge hit, breathing new life into the town and drawing crowds to the shops. Amidst this renewed bustle, Tei tells Tsutaju she's pregnant. Meanwhile, Sadanobu begins to lose support within the shogunate due to his hardline stance on foreign and imperial matters.

programme.desc: In a shared house on the outskirts of Tokyo, three lifelong friends live together, led by culinary expert Utako (Takeshita Keiko). One day, university student Hayami Shota (Jo Kairi) is invited to be Utako's secretary, sparking a lively exchange between generations. programme.desc: 劇場版第26弾。沈みゆく真実が暴かれたとき、黒き影が集結する――

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #487 【TVスペシャル】本庁の刑事恋物語8 左手の薬指
programme.desc: 高木刑事は、電話中の佐藤刑事に視線を向け、左手薬指にはめられた指輪に初めて気付く。佐藤の電話の相手は蘭。人が死んでいると連絡してきたのだ。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #488 【TVスペシャル】テレビ局の悪魔
programme.desc: コナンらは日売テレビにやってくる。仮面ヤイバーの撮影を見学するのだ。だが、見学は中止になり、代わりにテレビ局の中を見て回る事に。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #489 【TVスペシャル】法廷の対決III 目撃者は検察官
programme.desc: 東京拘置所で、妃は竹内浩明と面会する。竹内は酒を飲んだ後、車で被害者を跳ね、逃走したのだ。妃は釈放を請求するが、担当検事の九条はそれを断る。

programme.title: 名探偵コナンセレクション#490【TVSP】服部平次vs工藤新一 ゲレンデの推理対決！
programme.desc: コナンは服部平次と携帯電話で互いに今月解決した事件の数を報告しあい、解決数の多いコナンは1番だと勝ち誇る。すると平次は…

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #491 赤と黒のクラッシュ 発端
programme.desc: コナンは本堂瑛祐と父親が写っている写真を入手したと平次に電話で報告する。さらに西郡宗兵の友人から聞いた会話の内容も伝え、黒の組織と何らかの関わりがあると睨む。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #492 赤と黒のクラッシュ 血縁
programme.desc: コナンと蘭、園子、本堂は庵野に本堂の姉の写真を見せる。すると、怜奈の若い頃にしか見えないと断言。庵野が所有するビデオも確認する事に。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #493 赤と黒のクラッシュ 絶叫
programme.desc: 小五郎への依頼は丁度1年前に息子の鍛吾が亡くなった事件を調べ直す事。事件当日、角蔵と妻の詠子、家政婦の田端菊代、執事の瀬川旗郎は…。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #494 赤と黒のクラッシュ 冥土
programme.desc: 死体が発見され、高木刑事らが捜査にあたる。足元には「黄泉からの殺人者」という本が置かれていた。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #495 赤と黒のクラッシュ 昏睡
programme.desc: コナンは本堂と怜奈が兄姉ではないという確信を持てずにいた。本堂と連絡が取れなくなった事を蘭に教えてもらう。本堂は…。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #496 赤と黒のクラッシュ 侵入
programme.desc: 看護師、塩田まさ江の話から黒の組織の仲間が潜伏している事が判明。さらに、まさ江は本堂瑛祐を別の病院で手術した事を思い出しコナンに教える。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #497 赤と黒のクラッシュ 覚醒
programme.desc: 楠田はナースステーションに侵入し、怜奈の事を探るために写真撮影を行う。その時、拳銃を持ったジョディらが姿を現す。だが…。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #498 赤と黒のクラッシュ 攪乱
programme.desc: 赤井は捜査のため組織に潜り込んだ過去があり灰原の姉の宮野明美と恋人同士だった。病院の近辺では、同時刻に3つの事件が起きる。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #499 赤と黒のクラッシュ 偽装
programme.desc: 杯戸中央病院の患者たちに見舞い品を装った爆弾が送られてくる。病院を人で溢れさせたのは、パニックに紛れて大量の荷物を届けさせるためだったのだ。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #500 赤と黒のクラッシュ 遺言
programme.desc: 赤井が思いついた作戦を実行。赤井とコナンはわざと怜奈を組織に渡したのだ。赤井は怜奈と契約を結んだ事を告白。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #501 赤と黒のクラッシュ 嫌疑
programme.desc: コナンらはホテルのバイキングに向かう。コナンらがホテルに到着後高木刑事がパトカーでやってくる。殺害されたのは外国人タレントプロダクションの社長、須内廉治。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #502 赤と黒のクラッシュ 潔白
programme.desc: ホテルで外国人タレントプロダクションの社長、須内が殺害される。容疑者はモデルのトビー・ケインズ、英語教師のハル・バックナー、そしてFBIのキャメルの3人。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #503 赤と黒のクラッシュ 決死
programme.desc: キールはジンに脅され、赤井に2人きりで会おうという連絡を入れる。赤井はキールと会う覚悟を決める。その頃、須内の殺害事件でコナンは犯人を見抜く方法を目暮に説明。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #504 赤と黒のクラッシュ 殉職
programme.desc: 病院に戻ったジョディは赤井がキールに会いに行った事をジェイムズから教えられる。来葉峠で車が炎上し、遺体が発見されたニュースがテレビで流れる。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #505 弁護士妃英理の証言(前編)
programme.desc: 蘭はお母さんを迎えに行こうと小五郎に声をかける。英理は美容室にいるという。小五郎らが美容室付近の坂道を登った時、ガツン、ドサッという音が鳴り響く。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #506 弁護士妃英理の証言(後編)
programme.desc: 格闘家、永作司朗の遺体がゴミ置き場で発見され、元恋人の美容師、葉坂皆代に疑惑の目が向けられる。だが、妃英理が皆代のアリバイを証言。コナンは皆代が犯人だと疑い…

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #507 カラオケボックスの死角(前編)
programme.desc: 書店へ寄り道した少年探偵団は、本堂瑛祐、蘭、園子と偶然会う。店を出たコナンらを謎の男が尾行。コナンは本堂を監視するFBI捜査官が男の正体と推理する。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #508 カラオケボックスの死角(後編)
programme.desc: カラオケBOXの5号室で絶命した茂庭が発見される。目暮警部、高木刑事は客の部屋を回り、事情聴取しながら凶器を探す。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #509 赤白黄色と探偵団
programme.desc: コナンが少年探偵団、灰原と学校の下駄箱の所にいると、ジョディから携帯に連絡が入る。ジョディは水無怜奈から連絡があったとコナンに報告。

programme.title: 名探偵コナン セレクション #510 コナンｖｓＷ暗号ミステリー

programme.title: [4K]にっぽん縦断 こころ旅 蔵出しスペシャル「２０２３年１１月 福岡県」[字][再]
programme.desc: 今週の「こころ旅」は火野正平さんの「蔵出しスペシャル」！この日は２０２３年１１月、火野さんの秋の旅最後のゴールとなった福岡県の旅。名場面と未公開映像満載２９分！
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]大河ドラマ「べらぼう」瑣吉、春朗、貞一！心揺れる歌麿に蔦重は[字]
programme.desc: 蔦重（横浜流星）は身上半減の刑からの再起へ！滝沢瑣吉（津田健次郎）、勝川春朗（くっきー！）、重田貞一（井上芳雄）らが加わる一方、歌麿（染谷将太）の心は揺れ動く…

programme.title: [4K]ウルトラマン ４Ｋリマスター版（３３）禁じられた言葉[字][HDR][再]
programme.desc: メフィラス星人登場。フジ隊員の弟・サトルにテレパシーで語りかける謎の声。サトルを地球人の代表に選び「地球をあなたにあげます」と言わせようとするが…

programme.title: [4K]今度は４Ｋで「アストリッドとラファエル２」 毎週木曜夜９時
programme.desc: 緻密な文書係アストリッドと体当たり派の熱血警視ラファエル。正反対の２人が難事件に挑むミステリー、シーズン２を毎週木曜夜９時から、ＢＳＰ４Ｋで放送中。

programme.title: [4K]オカバンゴ ミニ[5.1][HDR]
programme.desc: 不毛の大地が一年のうち４か月だけ広大な湿原に変わるオカバンゴ。バッファローやゾウが群れで集まり、ライオンなどの肉食動物が狩りをする。命の躍動を極上の映像で描く。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.desc: シリーズ「プラネットアース」第３弾。今回の舞台は「海岸」。巨大な敵に挑むオットセイや神秘の生きもの、樹上の獲物を狩る魚など生きものの新たな姿を極上の映像で紹介。

programme.title: [4K]べらぼう〜蔦重栄華乃夢噺〜（４２）招かれざる客[5.1][解][字][HDR]

programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]“最美公路”をゆく〜中国 果てしなき絶景の道〜[字][HDR][再]
programme.desc: 中国で最も美しい景色に出会える道、“最美公路”。外国人の立ち入りは制限されているが、特別な協力を得て走破。圧倒的な絶景の数々と人々の知られざる暮らしを伝える。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.desc: 世界中で愛されたファミリードラマの金字塔がよみがえる！メアリーとローラは昆虫採集にキャリーを連れていく。するとキャリーは一人でちょうを追って野原を走り出し…。

programme.desc: 身上半減から店を立て直した蔦重（横浜流星）は、てい（橋本愛）の懐妊を知り、子どもの誕生を心待ちにする。一方、城中では定信（井上祐貴）が幕閣内で孤立し始めていた。

programme.title: [4K]【連続テレビ小説】どんど晴れ ＰＲ

programme.title: [4K]ドラマ 終活シェアハウス（３）[字]
programme.desc: 南米帰りの元書籍編集者・沼袋豪（石坂浩二）が、旧知の歌子（竹下景子）を訪ねてやってくる。彼のユニークな人生観が、翔太（城桧吏）や美果（畑芽育）にも影響を及ぼす。

programme.title: [4K]８Ｋタイムラプス紀行〜三重〜「四日市コンビナート」
programme.desc: ８Ｋデジタル一眼レフカメラで撮影した８Ｋタイムラプス紀行。幾何学模様の姿が浮かび上がる夜のコンビナートを、８Ｋの超高精細映像でご覧下さい。（２０１９年放送）
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]Ｔｈｅ Ｃｏｖｅｒｓ 秋の夜長のバラードナイト〜第１夜〜[字]
programme.desc: ＭＣ：リリー・フランキー上白石萌歌／氷川きよしが３年ぶりに登場！新生ＫＩＩＮＡ．の音楽原点・工藤静香＆ｇｌｏｂｅの名バラードをカバー！静香＆小室哲哉への思い語る

programme.title: [4K]１分で「刑事モース オックスフォード事件簿」毎週火曜日
programme.desc: 刑事モースが帰ってくる！オックスフォードを舞台にするどい観察眼を持つ若き刑事エンデバー・モースが難事件に挑む人気シリース。ＢＳＰ４Ｋで毎週火曜夕方４時２５分から

programme.title: ●土曜ミステリーファイル●仰天！海の底まる見え検証 ６「禁酒法時代の密輸船」
programme.desc: ２０世紀初頭にアメリカを支配したマフィアは、どのようにして富と権力を得たのか。各地で発見された船やトラックから、暗躍したマフィアの真実が明らかになる【二ヶ国語】
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: ●土曜ミステリーファイル●コロッセオ：死闘の娯楽とローマ帝国 声：細谷佳正[二]
programme.desc: 「巨大闘技場の新興」ローマ帝国に築かれた最大の建造物コロッセオの起源をひもとこう。イタリア各地に出向き、コロッセオと、剣闘士の闘技会の成り立ちを解き明かすのだ。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 潜入：アングラな闇組織を暴け！２「詐欺の都市」[字]
programme.desc: ある人身売買の映像を見たマリアナは、タイ・ミャンマー国境付近へ。豚の屠殺という新たな詐欺の実態を知るべく、不穏なうわさが広がる新興都市シュエコッコに潜入する。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 密着！マドリード・バラハス空港警察「コカイン密輸の摘発」[二]
programme.desc: アドルフォ・スアレス・マドリード・バラハス空港では、警察が常に目を光らせている。車いすの男性の荷物からコカイン２０キロが見つかり、空港職員の関与が疑われるが…。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 衝撃！ワースト１０ 世界の重大インシデント「探検中の事故」声：井上麻里奈[二]
programme.desc: 探検中に起きた事故をランキング形式で紹介。タイの洞窟に閉じ込められたサッカーチームや謎の文明を探してアマゾンで消息を絶った調査隊。その明暗を分けたものとは？
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 仰天！運び屋ｖｓ取締屋ｉｎ全米エアポート ３「コロナ禍の子犬繁殖ビジネス」[二]
programme.desc: アトランタ国際空港では、麻薬だけでなく、子犬の密輸も取り締まっている。コロナ禍でペット需要が急増。その結果、繁殖ビジネスが過熱し、密輸が後を絶たない。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: サベージ・キングダム３：戦乱の幕開け「＃３ 放浪者の出現」声：諏訪部順一[二]
programme.desc: 闇のハイエナ軍団のリーダー、マムッツィは向かうところ敵なしの状態だ。ライオンのラモハタは子宝に恵まれるが、その留守中に群れはかつてない危機に見舞われる。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 第二次世界大戦の潜水艦「Ｕボート：ドラムビート作戦」[二]
programme.desc: １９４２年１月、ハルデゲン艦長率いるＵボートがアメリカ東海岸沖に出没した。攻撃目標はニューヨーク港を出入りする輸送船だ。ナチスによるドラムビート作戦が幕を開けた
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 世界大自然紀行：インド〜逞しき野生の本能「雨季の森と乾季の森」声：梶裕貴[二]
programme.desc: 季節によって大きく姿を変えるインドのモンスーンの森。ここではどんな生き物であれ、乾季の干ばつから雨季の豪雨まで、季節の法則に従って生きていかなくてはならない。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: スゴ腕どうぶつドクター 総集編３「待ちに待ったホリデー」[二]
programme.desc: 祝日はみんな家族でお祝いするのが一般的だが動物には関係ない。祝日だろうと病気やケガの動物がクリニックにやってくる。ドクター・ポールは休み返上で命を救う。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: スゴ腕どうぶつドクター 総集編３「アナタのおそばに」[二]
programme.desc: ポール動物病院はチームワークが命！３人の獣医と頼れる助っ人チャールズ、信頼できるスタッフが一丸となって難しくて、変わっていて、かなり手強い動物達の病気治します！
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: チンギス・ハーン：モンゴル帝国最強の秘密「チンギス・ハーンの称号」[二]
programme.desc: テムジンは盟友ジャムカとの絆を深めたが、やがて決裂。敗北と流浪を経験した後、帰還したテムジンは、敵対勢力を次々と服従させ、「チンギス・ハーン」として即位する。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 密着エアポート！遺失物取扱所「家宝の腕時計、義眼」[二]
programme.desc: 義眼、エスプレッソマシン、ロレックスなど貴重品が登場。フィラデルフィア国際空港では、動物との触れ合いから旅行者のストレスを軽減させる取り組みが行われている。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: カー・ＳＯＳ 蘇れ！思い出の名車「フォード・マニア」[二]
programme.desc: ２０１２年制作／今回はボーンマスを訪れ、ボロボロのフォード・アングリアの再生に挑戦する。３週間で車はファズの理想通りに仕上がり、彼はこの車にほれこんでしまう。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: カー・ＳＯＳ 蘇れ！思い出の名車「帰ってきたローバー」[二]
programme.desc: ２０１２年制作／ティムとファズは１９７６年製ローバーＰ６をよみがえらせようと奮闘する。ずさんな修理が施されてきた車の修復は予想以上に重労働だ。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: カー・ＳＯＳ 蘇れ！思い出の名車８「初恋のオースチン７・チャミー」[二]

programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: ●集まれ！スゴ腕アニマルドクター●スゴ腕どうぶつドクター７「迷子救出作戦」[二]
programme.desc: ポール動物病院に拾われた子猫がやってくる。脚を負傷している子猫をドクター・ポールは予想外の方法で治療する。さらに、野良犬に襲われた家のない豚も運び込まれる。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.desc: カナダのユーコン準州で獣医師として働くミシェル・オークリー。今日も往診のため車を走らせます。今回は繁殖期を迎えたオスのジャコウウシを追いかけて診察します。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: ●集まれ！スゴ腕アニマルドクター●獣医ミシェルの日常 １．５[字]
programme.desc: 「カリブーの空中輸送」獣医師オークリーは絶滅危惧種のカリブーの群れの個体数回復を託され、ヘリコプターで妊娠中のメス４頭を救出。その他、疥癬症の豚なども診察する。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: スゴ腕どうぶつドクター５「学校を休んだモルモット」[二]

programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.desc: 「異常寒波」北極が急速に温暖化し寒気を閉じ込めるジェット気流が衰えた結果、北半球に寒気が南下し異例の寒波をもたらしている。冬の極端な現象を解説する。【二ヶ国語】
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: ●日曜大惨事検証ファイル●メーデー！７：航空機事故の真実と真相[二]
programme.desc: 「ブリティッシュ・エアツアーズ２８便」マンチェスター空港を離陸しようとしていた飛行機が異音を理由に離陸を中止した直後、エンジンから出火して機体が炎に包まれる。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: ●日曜大惨事検証ファイル●メーデー！７：航空機事故の真実と真相[二]

programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.desc: メキシコとの国境で男性がフェンタニルの錠剤を体内に隠し持っていた。ＪＦＫ国際空港ではエクスタシー錠が入った小包を発見。小包の宛先に家宅捜索をかけることに。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: ファイナル・デッドコースター

programme.title: グラマラス・ハンターズ

programme.title: 獣医ミシェルの日常 ９「高齢バイソンの危機」[二]
programme.desc: アラスカ野生生物保護センターで、トゲに苦戦しつつヤマアラシの検診を終えて足を引きずるバイソンのグランマの元へ。診察を試みるミシェルに、まさかのハプニングが。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: ●モーニング・Ｄｒ．ポール●スゴ腕どうぶつドクター５[二]
programme.desc: 「ドクター・フランケンポール」首を噛まれてフランケンシュタインのようになった子犬、散弾を撃ち込まれたネコ、そしてコスチューム…戦慄と涙のハロウィーン特集！
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: ●モーニング・Ｄｒ．ポール●スゴ腕どうぶつドクター６「エミュー救出大作戦」[二]
programme.desc: 今日も大忙しのポール動物病院！７歳と思われていた２０歳の馬、立てない子羊、獰猛なネコ、喉が枯れてしまったニワトリ、そして、エミューの救出大作戦！
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 【『仰天！運び屋ｖｓ取締屋ｉｎカリブ海』一挙放送】「コカインと現金」[二]
programme.desc: 航空海上部隊に密着。プエルトリコでは不審な航路を取るヨーラと呼ばれる漁船を追う。バージン諸島には新人取締官が着任。追跡した船には莫大な現金が残されていた。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 仰天！運び屋ｖｓ取締屋ｉｎカリブ海「暗礁に乗り上げたコカイン」[二]
programme.desc: バージン諸島の航空海上部隊は国境警備隊の精鋭ボルタックと連携し密輸組織を取り締まる。プエルトリコでは座礁した密輸船から１３００キロ以上のコカインが発見された。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 仰天！運び屋ｖｓ取締屋ｉｎカリブ海「麻薬ディーラーとの闘い」[二]
programme.desc: プエルトリコのサンフアンでは、麻薬ディーラーたちへ奇襲をかける。ファハルドでは、ボートに乗っていた男の一人に不法入国の疑いがあるため、港まで付いていくことに。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 仰天！運び屋ｖｓ取締屋ｉｎカリブ海「麻薬密輸船からのＳＯＳ」[二]
programme.desc: 捜査局は麻薬密輸組織のメンバー１８名をプエルトリコ全土で一斉逮捕する作戦を敢行。航空海上部隊は転覆船から膨大な量のコカインが流出するという異例の事態に遭遇する。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 仰天！運び屋ｖｓ取締屋ｉｎカリブ海「漂流する現金」[二]
programme.desc: バージン諸島の沖で密輸組織の売上を運んでいた船が浸水した。翌日、漂流予測地点を捜索していると、別の船が現れたとの連絡が。現金の回収に来た組織側の船なのだろうか。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 仰天！運び屋ｖｓ取締屋ｉｎカリブ海「コンテナに隠されたコカイン」[二]
programme.desc: プエルトリコのサンフアン港で国土安全保障捜査局が張り込みを行う。ドミニカ共和国からの合法な輸送コンテナでコカインが押収され、港湾労働者の関与が疑われるからだ。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 仰天！運び屋ｖｓ取締屋ｉｎカリブ海「大海原を漂うコカイン」[二]
programme.desc: アメリカ領バージン諸島では地元の漁師から寄せられた情報をもとに航空海上部隊が海上を漂うコカインの捜索に乗り出した。広大な海原からちっぽけな包みを探し出せるか。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 仰天！運び屋ｖｓ取締屋ｉｎカリブ海「密輸船とのボートチェイス」[二]
programme.desc: アメリカ領バージン諸島の航空海上部隊は、不審なボートを追跡してイギリス領へ。マヤグエスでは、移民船がいるとの連絡を受け出動。ファハルドでは、怪しいボートと遭遇。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 仰天！運び屋ｖｓ取締屋ｉｎカリブ海「隠しカメラに映った容疑者」[二]
programme.desc: 自然豊かなバージン諸島は麻薬や不法移民を運ぶ密輸業者には格好の環境だ。その監視用の隠しカメラに映った容疑者を追いかけ、取締官たちがセント・トーマス島を走り回る。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 仰天！運び屋ｖｓ取締屋ｉｎカリブ海「死と隣り合わせの現場」[二]
programme.desc: ファハルド沖の密輸ルートで発見されたボートには９００キロを超えるコカインが積まれていた。マヤグエスなどでは殉職した取締官を弔うための５キロマラソンが行われた。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: スゴ腕どうぶつドクター７「ドッグファイト・スペシャル」[二]
programme.desc: 大騒ぎしている子猫の声で一日がスタートしたクリニック。そこへケンカをしたグレート・デーンが運ばれる。その後、なぜかケンカでケガをした犬ばかり次々とやって来て…。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: スゴ腕どうぶつドクター８「頂点を目指して」[二]
programme.desc: 今年も品評会の季節がやってきた。本番を迎えるまでには様々なドラマが。呼吸器に異常のある牛や歩こうとしないブタをドクター・ポールは無事に品評会へ送り出せるのか。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: スゴ腕どうぶつドクター９「運を味方に」[二]
programme.desc: コロナ禍でもポール動物病院の忙しさは変わらない。体重の増えないブタ、結石に悩む犬、調子の悪いヤギ、目にケガをした猫など、さまざまな患畜がやってくる。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 失われた暗黒時代の財宝 声：石田彰[二]
programme.desc: ２００９年、イギリスで宝探しが趣味のテリーが金属探知機を使い金銀の財宝の破片を発見した。調査が進むにつれ、７世紀のイングランドの姿が浮き彫りになる。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 密着！空港警察：南アメリカ「大量のコカイン」[二]
programme.desc: コロンビアとペルーを代表する空港で、大量のコカインが押収された。ドミニカに旅行する青年はコカインを隠していたが、本人が知らないところにもコカインが潜んでいた。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 密着エアポート！遺失物取扱所「お宝スニーカー、改造理髪店」[二]
programme.desc: ビンテージの靴、ぬいぐるみなどが持ち主と再会するまでを追う。放置された荷物には警察犬が動員される。遺失物オークションでは床屋のイスがついたバンが競り落とされる。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: メーデー！１９：航空機事故の真実と真相「プロップエア４２０便」[二]
programme.desc: １９９８年、カナダプロップエア４２０便が離陸直後に２系統の油圧トラブルとエンジン火災の警告を受けた。なんとか空港まで戻ってきたが、着陸寸前に墜落してしまった。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: メーデー！１１：航空機事故の真実と真相「カンタス航空３２便」[二]
programme.desc: ２０１３年制作／カンタス３２便Ａ３８０のエンジンが爆発。パイロットは次々と発生する障害への対応に追われる。運航中の全てのＡ３８０が危険なのか？
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: メーデー！１５：航空機事故の真実と真相「ノースウエスト・エアリンク５７１９便」
programme.desc: ノースウエスト・エアリンク５７１９便がミネソタ州北部で墜落、全員が死亡した。ボイスレコーダーからパイロットたちの人間関係が崩壊していた事実が明らかに【二ヶ国語】
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 潜入！ブラックマーケットの実態 ３「ラグプル」[字]
programme.desc: 暗号資産詐欺の一種「ラグプル」が横行している。マリアナはラグプルで奪ったお金で豪勢に暮らす２０代の詐欺師たちに接触し、法の隙を突いたその手口を暴いていく。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: メーデー！１２：航空機事故の真実と真相「ブリティッシュミッドランド航空９２便」
programme.desc: ２０１４年制作／ブリティッシュミッドランド航空９２便が離陸直後、機体が大きく揺れ、煙の臭気が充満する。事故はエンジンの故障が原因と思われたが…【二ヶ国語】
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: チャーリーとチョコレート工場◆特集：チャーリーとチョコレート工場◆
programme.desc: 世界中から選ばれた５人の子供が、ミステリアスなチョコレート工場の見学に訪れる、小説家ロアルド・ダールの名作を実写化した、ジョニー・デップ主演のファンタジー。

programme.title: 夢のチョコレート工場◆特集：チャーリーとチョコレート工場◆
programme.desc: 名優ジーン・ワイルダーが贈るファンタジー。世界中の子供たちを魅了するチョコレート工場を舞台に、子供たちが大冒険を繰り広げる。

programme.title: ＴＨＥ ＷＩＴＣＨ／魔女 −増殖−【日本語吹替版】
programme.desc: 『ＴＨＥ ＷＩＴＣＨ／魔女』と世界観を共有するバトル・アクション。名もなき少女を新たな主人公に据え、彼女の宿命をめぐる戦いを描く。

programme.title: 陽動作戦
programme.desc: ジェフ・チャンドラーが根っからの職業軍人に扮した戦争ドラマ。第二次世界大戦末期、ビルマ戦線を舞台に“陽動作戦”と呼ばれる囮作戦を描く。

programme.title: トリプルクロス
programme.desc: クリストファー・プラマー、ユル・ブリンナー共演のスパイ・アクション。初期『００７』シリーズのテレンス・ヤング監督が実話を基に第二次大戦下のスパイをリアルに描く。

programme.title: シティヒート
programme.desc: クリント・イーストウッド＆バート・レイノルズの強力タッグ！ライバル意識ムキ出しの刑事と私立探偵が手を組み、暗黒街の巨大組織と戦うアクション。

programme.title: ウォンカとチョコレート工場のはじまり◆ＣＳ初放送◆
programme.desc: 『チャーリーとチョコレート工場』に登場したチョコレート工場の誕生秘話。ティモシー・シャラメが若き日のウィリー・ウォンカを演じるファンタジー。

programme.title: ロミオ・マスト・ダイ
programme.desc: ジェット・リーのハリウッド初主演作となるハード・アクション。殺害された弟の復讐のため、マフィアに闘いを挑む元刑事の姿を描く。

programme.title: インターステラー◆監督：クリストファー・ノーラン◆
programme.desc: クリストファー・ノーラン監督×マシュー・マコノヒー、アン・ハサウェイが贈るＳＦアドベンチャー。居住可能な惑星を探す人類の壮大なミッションを描く。

programme.title: グリーン・ランタン【日本語吹替版】
programme.desc: 米ＤＣコミックのヒーロー作品を実写映画化。ライアン・レイノルズ主演。宇宙警察機構“グリーン・ランタン”の一員となった男の壮絶なバトルを描く。

programme.title: テイラー・スウィフト：スーパースター
programme.desc: “トップ・オブ・ディーヴァ”テイラー・スウィフトの軌跡を辿るドキュメンタリー。

programme.title: マドンナ：ポップの女神
programme.desc: “ポップの女王”マドンナの軌跡に迫るドキュメンタリー。

programme.title: デイヴィッド・フォスター：偉大なるソングライターたち
programme.desc: 伝説的なソングライターの創作プロセスとインスピレーションに、撮り下ろしの本人インタビューとスタジオ・ライヴで迫るシリーズ番組。デイヴィッド・フォスターが登場！

programme.title: セリーヌ・ディオン：世紀のディーヴァ
programme.desc: 誰もが知る世界的歌姫セリーヌ・ディオンの軌跡に迫るドキュメンタリー。（2023年制作）

programme.desc: 今回はサマーソニック2019に出演 したソウル界のニュー・スター、マヘリアが登場。(2019年制作)

programme.title: キンクス：ロック・レジェンズ

programme.title: ★偶然見えた胸チラしている姿に発情しちゃった俺２

programme.title: ★青空ひかり 平凡な１児のママがある日突然、サレ妻になった。
programme.desc: 平凡な毎日を過ごす１児の母、ひかり。ある日見知らぬ男から自分の妻とひかりの旦那が浮気している事実を告げられる。ひかりは男からの“火遊び”の提案に乗ってしまい…。

programme.title: ★性交総合大学病院 看護師による口淫・手淫・性交を通じた射精医療。
programme.desc: 性交総合大学病院では、全１０科の治療に粘膜接触を通した男性器の機能改善処置を伴う“射精治療”を採用。今回は日々奮闘するナースたちのすべてをお届けいたします。

programme.title: ★図書館で声も出せず糸引くほど愛液が溢れ出す敏感娘３２
programme.desc: シリーズ第３２弾！静かな館内でイカサレ続け…痴女覚醒！保育士・看護師・インストラクター・生け花講師が驚愕の豹変！働く清楚女の想像を遥かに超えるエロさに完敗！

programme.title: ★ＭＭ便 品格漂う美容部員さん 初めての公開ディープキス編 ｖｏｌ．０７
programme.desc: シリーズ第７弾！美容部員さんたちにディープキスの突撃交渉！いきなりの提案に恥じらい戸惑うＢＡたちも舌と舌を絡ませ合う濃厚な接吻をしていくたびに…。

programme.title: ★鈴村あいり クレーム謝罪ハラスメント
programme.desc: 小さな会社で日々勤しむ鈴村。ある日、業界最大手の取引先を相手に大きなミスをしてしまう。取引先からのクレームに土下座をするが許してもらえず理不尽な精液を…。

programme.desc: アイポケ人気シリーズ「汗と絶頂」ベストがついに登場！汗と性液がまざり合う本能剥き出しのSEXで絶頂を繰り返す美女。綺麗な女たちの獣ファックは最高に興奮する。

programme.title: ★義父に犯される巨乳妻たち４
programme.desc: 夫との性生活の不満は身体にずっと疼きを残しています。それを解消するのは…不思議なことにこの嫌悪感しかない義父が私に向ける汚らしくいやらしい目線だけなのです…。

programme.title: ★快楽シンドローム ｃａｓｅ６ 宮沢ちはる
programme.desc: 純朴で清楚感漂う小柄な美女ですが、見た目とは裏腹に歪んだ性癖があるんです！責められて限界悶絶すると脳汁覚醒して泣きながらアヘ顔でイキ堕ちた！

programme.title: ★巨乳のお母さんが童貞で悩む息子の親友と２人っきりの密室で筆おろし！
programme.desc: 昨今、親友のお母さんと筆おろしセックスがしたいと連絡をくれる若者男子が急増！その願望を叶えるため「マジックミラーの向こうには●●」で完全バックアップします！

programme.title: ★ひよこ女子の究極“奥イキ”開発×いちゃいちゃポルチオＳＥＸのすすめ。２
programme.desc: シリーズ第２弾！どうせなら美少女とポルチオＳＥＸ！俺もこんなＳＥＸがしたかった！女子を痙攣するほどイカせたいメンズへ、いちゃいちゃポルチオＳＥＸのすすめ！

programme.title: ★ＡＶ初撮り！恥じらい五十路熟女Ｐａｒｔ．１３ ４時間
programme.desc: 胸に秘めたエロさを炸裂させて、AV男優の逞しいイチモツとテクニックによる初の強烈な快感に没入、息も絶え絶えな状態でイキまくるリアルな痴態を堪能させてくれます。

programme.title: ★矢埜愛茉 義妹がシンママとなって実家に出戻り
programme.desc: 田舎に出戻りした加奈子は元トップアイドルだった。シンママとなり定年退職した父と無職の兄と生活をする。そして兄とは過去、肉体関係にあった。久しぶりに再会するも…。

programme.title: ★やっぱり妻が好きだ！再燃した夫婦の濃厚セックス！４時間ＢＥＳＴ
programme.desc: 再燃した夫婦の濃厚セックスを描く高評価多数の人気シリーズ初ベスト！冷めていた夫婦関係から再び愛を深めてお互いを貪り合う大人の濃厚なセックスがエロい！

programme.sub-title: A Mobile "Warabi Mochi" Cart in Fukuoka
programme.desc: A mobile food cart selling a traditional Japanese sweet has been plying the streets of Fukuoka for over 75 years. For three days, we talked to customers fond of a snack unchanged over the decades.

programme.title: Science View
programme.sub-title: Special Episode: Shining Hope for Myotonic Dystrophy -A New Drug Discovery
programme.desc: There is a doctor who is working to develop drugs to treat myotonic dystrophy, an incurable disease. We take a closer look at Professor Masayuki NAKAMORI of Yamaguchi University and his challenge.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Journeys in Japan
programme.sub-title: SILK Road: Threads of History from Gunma to Yokohama
programme.desc: In 1859, when Japan reopened its doors after more than two centuries of isolation, goods flowed in and out of newly expanded ports. At the time, raw silk became the country's largest export, as the silk industries in France and Italy had been hit by an epidemic of silkworm disease. At one point, Japan was the world's biggest exporter. On this episode of Journeys in Japan, Sheila Cliffe from the UK follows the Silk Road from northern Kanto, once a major production area, to Yokohama, where the silk took off to the world.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to kage, meaning both shadow and shade. From rooting for someone working toward their dreams, to expressing appreciation for those around you, words involving kage are surprisingly common in daily conversation. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through such unique words and the culture behind them.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon is a 300-year-old matsuri held in Yatsuo, Toyama Prefecture. Eleven neighborhoods choose their own routes, dances and parade styles, all of which feature elegant music, dancing and singing. Originally a prayer for bountiful harvests and lasting prosperity, it is a community event in which only local people dance and perform. With the threat of COVID-19 receding, the festival went ahead in 2022 for the first time in three years, to the great delight of Yatsuo residents.

programme.title: DEEPER LOOK
programme.sub-title: Charting the Future of the Olympics: David Wallechinsky / Co-Founder, International Society of Olympic Historians
programme.desc: What's next for the Olympic Games under its first female president? Historian David Wallechinsky joins to discuss the future of the IOC, costs, corruption, inclusion, and Asia's role.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Dining with the Chef
programme.sub-title: Rika's Tokyo Cuisine:Beef Tataki/ Udon with Shiso Sauce
programme.desc: Chef Rika's Beef Tataki is inspired by Kochi's beloved Katsuo no Tataki, seared bonito with vegetables. She recreates it with wagyu beef and chilled udon in a refreshing Japanese herb sauce.

programme.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.sub-title: A Home That Transcends Language and Identity
programme.desc: Afuso Michie is a Japanese-Brazilian woman who runs a center in Kanagawa Prefecture that offers Japanese language classes and other services which help foreign residents find their footing.

programme.title: DOSUKOI Sumo Salon
programme.desc: This time, a technique involving clamping the opponent's shoulder then pulling them down. We take a close look and examine why the under shoulder swing down is becoming more popular!

programme.title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords
programme.desc: Japanese swords, admired since ancient times for their beauty, are amazing works of art. This time, a powerful weapon with a beautiful hamon: Daihannya Nagamitsu.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.sub-title: Plum Estate, Kameido by Utagawa Hiroshige
programme.desc: With its splendid branches and white plum blossoms, this famous painting is known for captivating Van Gogh. Discover why people were able to tell this was a specific tree at Kameido Umeyashiki.

programme.title: Japan in Focus
programme.sub-title: Ama Divers Restoring the Earthquake-Hit Seabed
programme.desc: In 2024, natural disasters devastated the fishing grounds of the ama (free divers) in Wajima, Noto. We follow their efforts to survey the seabed and revive their tradition.

programme.title: Document 72 Hours
programme.sub-title: A Mobile "Warabi Mochi" Cart in Fukuoka
programme.desc: A mobile food cart selling a traditional Japanese sweet has been plying the streets of Fukuoka for over 75 years. For three days, we talked to customers fond of a snack unchanged over the decades.

programme.title: Journeys in Japan
programme.sub-title: SILK Road: Threads of History from Gunma to Yokohama
programme.desc: In 1859, when Japan reopened its doors after more than two centuries of isolation, goods flowed in and out of newly expanded ports. At the time, raw silk became the country's largest export, as the silk industries in France and Italy had been hit by an epidemic of silkworm disease. At one point, Japan was the world's biggest exporter. On this episode of Journeys in Japan, Sheila Cliffe from the UK follows the Silk Road from northern Kanto, once a major production area, to Yokohama, where the silk took off to the world.
